website_summaries.verdict: Comfortable grip, smooth retraction, easy locking, and intuitive controls. Its only drawback is that it's prone to tearing at the site of any defects.
pros: Sizes for small, medium, and large dogs
cons: Material is vulnerable to tearing at the site of cuts, nicks, or other defects

website_summaries.verdict: Extremely comfortable for the user, this tangle-free leash gives your dog freedom to move, but locks into place when you need it.
pros: Ergonomic, non-slip handle houses 16-foot tape leash
Tangle free design with retraction that adjusts easily
Various sizes for dogs of varying weights
cons: Some reports of the leash ripping if there's a defect in the tape, especially if your dog lunges

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Better customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these retractable leashes, and had a great first experience walking my 2 kids (2 pitbulls 90 lbs & 70 lbs). Before the second walk the big one chewed up the tape. Tim from Tug Pet Products emailed me about receiving the product and after explaining, he sent me a new replacement. I went from feeling like I spent double on one leash to completely satisfied as a customer of Tug Pet Products. Thank you, Tim and TPP!! PS. If you make an unchewable version, let me know!
customer_reviews.author: darkwing duck

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and well designed!
customer_reviews.text: Well designed! Comfortable to hold and very smooth operation. The temporary lock is very easy to lock, which I could see being very helpful to anyone with weak hands or arthritis. The hold lock feature is smooth as well, easy to manipulate. The leash is allowed to extend and retract in a wide array of angles without binding which has been a great feature for our use.
customer_reviews.author: DS Tippie

customer_reviews.title: The leash was very sturdy and feels great in my hand
customer_reviews.text: My 60 lb labrador and golden retriever mix is not leash trained well at all. The leash was very sturdy and feels great in my hand. The retracting mechanism worked like a charm and I definitely would recommend after trying plenty of others. Can't beat the price either!
customer_reviews.author: Mikail

customer_reviews.title: Good product! I have 2 large labs (one is ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product! I have 2 large labs (one is 90 pounds and one is 60 pounds). They both pull on the leash and it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Catie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS LEASH!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this leash! I have two ~20lb. furbabies, 2-year-old Beagle and 1-year-old Dachshund/Pomeranian Mix. Both VERY energetic & erratic on a leash (especially if the beagle catches a scent!). My fiancee and I purchased this leash, and attached a bungee leash coupler to allow us to walk them both at the same time. We love the soft grip on the handle, and the lock button is easy to push! We've ordered several leashes from Amazon and after a few weeks or so, they're worn or completely dysfunctional. The TUG Leash has been through Louisiana thunderstorms, and the bouncing/pulling/biting of 2 very happy furbabies!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We recently took our two big girls to the beach and these Tug retractable leashes worked great. It gave them a little extra run-around room and let them feel they could explore but also gave us great control to know we could stop them from getting into things they shouldn't. They were easy to operate and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: VogueFauxReal

customer_reviews.title: Not great for tuggers :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a 50 pound Treeing Tennesee Brindle who LOVES squirrels and on our walks when he sees a squirrel he just goes nuts trying to chase after them. The first walk I took him on with this the plastic piece to help the leash recoil around on the inside popped right out. I returned it and bought another one thinking it was just a bad one. Unfortunately the same exact thing happened on the second one. I will not recommend this product for anyone with a dog who is a hard tugger. or at least a big dog that loves to tug.
customer_reviews.author: JSG9293

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me but good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Gets stuck and won’t unlock, therefore pulls my pup back abruptly... TUG is right, and not in a good way. :-( not impressed. Update: My 8lb morkie just chewed the leash and ran away. I was terrified I would never see him again, luckily I called and he came back... This company needs to make their leashes stronger... He’s chewed his previous leashes but has never broken free :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazonazing

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is this thing is awesome. I was in the market for an affordable ...
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is this thing is awesome. I was in the market for an affordable retractable leash and this thing delivered. Nice solid construction. No problem with my 50lb lab pup. Super intuitive controls, doesn't snag like others seem to, and the price is right on.
customer_reviews.author: Sten

customer_reviews.title: BROKE after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: This leash BROKE while we were using it with our 15 pound dog. Not only is this product poor quality (a leash shouldn't snap in half when using it with a small dog!!!) our dog almost escaped into a forest. DO NOT BUY THIS LEASH. UPDATE: TUG customer service wrote back very promptly and gave me a refund. I appreciate this, and hope they can improve their product in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ab5b

customer_reviews.title: Puppy is only 25 lbs not sure how this can happen and glad is was not as they were crossing the street
customer_reviews.text: Leash snapped in 3 days as my son was walking our puppy. Puppy is only 25 lbs not sure how this can happen and glad is was not as they were crossing the street.
customer_reviews.author: James McNeice

customer_reviews.title: How bad can you get
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cause I needed a new one to take on vacation. I used it on my Australian Sheppard 45ls. Broke the second time I used it and he wasn't really pulling much. I was going to switch it to the German Shepard but was testing it on the Aussie. Anyway, the worst product in the world. Now I have to drive to wallmart to buy something else since I won't be home for a week and can't wait to send this back and get my money back... Used two times, not even a tear aclean break
customer_reviews.author: DJ_Flannigan

customer_reviews.title: This should be a top choice for a leash
customer_reviews.text: Much bigger than i thought it was going to be but feels very sturdy and well built. Works great on my 88lb yellow lab. The packing was great as well. I would ventre to say for this price this should be most peoples choices for a leash. 7/6/18 update - held up well but my dog chewed through the leash cable. He does that when im not walking him fast enough. He did this multiple times before it finally broke after months of use. Not upset and bought another.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Lock not secure, easy to accidentally unlock.
customer_reviews.text: The lock is on the thumb pad. If you have a dog that lunges like mine this is a terrible design. We rescued our dog from a shelter where she had been for 7 months. She has terrible manners on the leash and wants to chase other dogs. The first time we passed another dog with this leash she lunged at it and my finger slipped and released the lock. She took off like a shot after the other dog and owner and I was scrambling to reel her back in. This lock is not secure and is far too easy to accidentally unlock.
customer_reviews.author: JZJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to lock and unlock.
customer_reviews.text: We went through quite a few leashes before finding this one. This is a good size of our Poochon. It's not so strong that it chokes him and he can still roll around on the grass. He does like to chew the leash though and has already started to fray. What I really like is how easy it is to temporarily lock the leash and not have it stay locked unless I flip the button. The others were too cumbersome to lock/unlock.
customer_reviews.author: A&M

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this leash.
customer_reviews.text: This leash is great. The leash hand grip is comfortable. The least extends and contracts easily. Only thing I would suggest is having some kind of reflective coating on the leash so when I’m walking my dog at night the leash is visible. Otherwise this is a great leash and durable. Even when my teething pup pulls on this leash with her teeth it hasn’t frayed. Dog chewed through it but it last longer than any other retractable leash I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Shanti Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: My basset hound walks better with this leash
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would like this leash but ended up giving it a try. My stubborn dog (basset hound) actually walks better on this leash than the others. I think it's due to the increased flexibility it gives him combined with the consistent tension. It has actually made walking him easier. I have yet to have this leash tangle. The only suggestion I could give is a little loop to hold poop bags would be wonderful. Otherwise for us it's a pretty perfect leash. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best designed and capable dog leash I have owned over ...
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best designed and capable dog leash I have owned over 40 years and 5 canine best friends in my lifetime. It's comfortable to use and what I like the best, Buster my 100 lb. half Irish Setter/ Yellow Lab can be quite a handful even at 4 years of age and the thumb brake on this leash provides excellent control for him. And after I realized all of this, the price was an added bonus. They did a great job making this.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: ... loves to pull me unsuspectingly and make me look like an IDIOT
customer_reviews.text: I have a 85lbs pit who loves to pull me unsuspectingly and make me look like an IDIOT....this leash has stood up to some serious tug of war battles. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a great product. I was so impressed with the packaging and attention to detail and apparent quality. I'm returning it only because it's too large for my dog (who is 18 pounds) and too large in my hand. I'm going to look for something a little smaller. I wish it was the right size, otherwise I'd love to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Good construction
customer_reviews.text: I mainly got this leash for my 25lb fox terrier but also use it for my 10lb doxxie mix. The leash itself reels in and out very smooth. Never have issues with tangles or twists. The terrier has run full sprint to the end of the line and the leash held fine. Also comfortable to hold and feels well constructed. I cant speak for larger breeds but it has worked perfectly for my medium and small dogs
customer_reviews.author: VanetiaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: These are a game changer for my pups!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for approximately one month now and they're wonderful. Self retracting and extends approximately 16 ft but they also have a stop button so I can stop the leash short if needed. My dogs are each approximately 80 lb and they pull a lot and these have not had any problems whatsoever. I walk the dogs 5 days a week for about 2 mi each day and so far the leashes work absolutely perfect. A tree Five Star product
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome five star product!
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this to my sister for her dog on Christmas. I waited to review the product to see how long it lasted and let me tell you I just couldn’t wait to review. This seems to wear incredibly well for the crazy pulls her dog typically makes on the daily chasing for squirrels or birds. She says she has accidentally dropped it a few times now. Were other products have simple broken on a single drop this seems to withstand harsh drops and regular wear with lock feature still in place. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash - Two Thumbs Up!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this leash for a week now with our 45 pound husky. It works very smooth and seems well built. The ribbon cord is sturdy and we expect to get a long service life out of the leash. So far we are totally satisfied with its quality and operation. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my stubborn English Bulldog. It has been great for long walks where I can have her walk at her own pace without either of us breaking stride. It is well made and super sturdy. My pup is at 50+ lbs and it holds up with ease when she tugs or wants to chase rabbits and birds. I love that the control button is so well placed and friendly on the thumb. I've used it for walks of over an hour and was pleased to note that neither my wrist nor my shoulder hurt!
customer_reviews.author: Tjendol

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made retractable leash. Works smoothly and IS tangle free! Use it to keep our 2 yr. old Aussie on a short leash when walking. He's very strong...when he was 10 mos. old pulled me off my feet and dragged me 50' across the yard (thank god all the neighbors were at work and didn't see that!) and so far this leash has more than served the purpose of keeping him close. Use it with a Babyltrl Big Dog Harness No Pull Adjustable Pet Reflective Oxford Soft Vest for Large Dogs Easy Control Harness. It's a life saver and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with these leashes!
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice leashes! I have one very small dog(8lbs) Yorkie and one medium(35lbs) wire haired terrier and these leashes work very well for both. I love how smooth they extend and retract. Also, they don't snap back in like a bullet, they just glide when you unhook from your dog. They are exactly as described and pictured.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 4 months, excellent CS
customer_reviews.text: After a little over four months, the nylon ribbon/tape is starting to unravel in several spots. We don’t let our golden doodle chew on it so it’s just from use and wear. Not very pleased with its durability. Other than that it has been fine. I’ll have to get another, but I’ll be looking at other brands. UPDATE: Tug contacted me and are sending me another leash even though I’m already past the usual Amazon return period. I’ve adjusted my rating from three to four stars due to their excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I got the small and it is HUGE. The least itself is small but the handle is large and heavy. I even checked the packaging thinking they had sent the wrong one. The reason I ordered this was because of the locking mechanism. My previous one (different brand) would allow you to press the button down to lock the leash in place but would often come loose, thus the reason for purchasing this one. On this TUG leash you push the button down then slide locking mechanism. It usually works as long as the leash doesn't get bumped. The second something touches that button it pops up and the leash releases. Super frustrating and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I’m the stores these retractable leashes are expensive, for a decent quality leash. I’ve purchased cheaper ones only for them to break in less than a year. This one feels like it will last! The leash glides well which is a good sign. Only con is that the pull of the leash can be a bit strong for my little 4 lb dog. I notice him struggling to keep his balance while going number 2, so I lock the leash and give him some slack so he can balance himself without being pulled on 😆
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Best leash I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: This leash is amazing. I didn’t think it would be that different from other similar (and less expensive) type of leashes, but for some reason it is. All of it feels like great quality and it’s comfortable to hold. The buttons are the easiest I’ve ever used with extendable leashes. It has patented technology so the leash will not tangle when it detracts back into the mechanism, so I never have to worry about it. I love this leash.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd gotten one a few years ago
customer_reviews.text: For 9 years I walked my border collie/terrier mix on a standard leash. She loves her freedom with the extra length and her new harness. Because there's always some tension on the leash, I wouldn't recommend it's use with a standard collar. You do have to stay more aware of obstacles and traffic. For example coming up to an intersection; you need to shorten the leash. She's already figured out when the leash is locked because there's a slight bumping in the plastic housing of the handle that tips her off and she walks nicely by my side. I would only recommend this type of leash for a dog already trained to walk by your side.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Chewed Not Broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5m American Bulldog pup. It lasted 6 months (by then he was 90lbs) and it never broke- he chewed through it. The manufacturer was great about honoring the warranty. I am writing this at his 1st birthday and He is 100lbs and it is still holding up. My advice? Spend the extra money and buy the chew prevention strap if you have a hard chewer. This leash is great.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenSan

customer_reviews.title: Great Function. But White Color?
customer_reviews.text: It works great in every way that these are supposed to. However - white? C'mon people. We actually use these outside. The one time your dog pulls this out of your hand and across the lawn, it's permanently marked with grass and dirt stains. Who wants to spend all that time cleaning this thing? Either make it of something stain resistant or simply make it gray or black or brown or something... anything but white.
customer_reviews.author: Nick777

customer_reviews.title: Read my review!  It should make you smile!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a rescue dog yesterday (8/27/2020) Haven't owned a dog in almost 15 years and that many years ago, I'm not sure they had leashes like that. Maybe they did, I don't know. Anyway, I have a new friend, a five year old Chihuahua, who was somewhat recently gave birth, was then fixed, microchipped, dewormed, tested and given preventative for Heartworm, etc. She came from Kentucky after being found as a stray and not claimed and now has come to my home in Pennsylvania to her forever home. Yay! Anyway, this leash is AWESOME! It works perfectly and has plenty of line so she can explore the grass. It's a great product for sure! You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Love the leash
customer_reviews.text: Love the leash. Made well. Functional and attractive! It retracts well. So much better than skinny rope one that cut my hands if I grabbed it in emergency. Makes walks more pleasant than my old one with knots that caught when retracting and no more sore hands!
customer_reviews.author: jewel72

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for large dogs that pull
customer_reviews.text: I like to let my dogs wander on their walks, but sometimes that means they try to drag me (60lb and 90lb dogs). I can handle it, but they about kill my wife. The way this leash locks down if they pull when you have the button down takes most of the pressure off the walker. It is also tough and can handle a 90lb dog charging one way while a 165lb man pulls the other way. The only thing I don't like is the mechanism for locking the leash at a shorter length. It's harder to engage than most. The anti-yank portion of the lock more than makes up for it. Great purchase, so I got a second.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Have been using a more expensive German made 26' leash but dog chewed through the cords when I foolishly left him un-supervised. Also the longer leash was allowing him to get more of a running start when cats, rabbits, or squirrels would appear and i have been pulled to the ground several times. This leash is only 15' and my dog tends to always be at the full extension of the cord so doesn't have so much lead. Mechanism is very smooth and if I only have one complaint it would be the lock button if so easy to trip I have frequently triggered the lock surprising my dog. i use this leash almost always now.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey D. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a retractable leash with a cord since those can be very dangerous. Love the new TUG leash! It doesn't tangle, retracts quickly and is plenty strong for my 60# mutt who is quite a puller. Of course I wouldn't let him run to the end and both of us deal with the impact or maybe damage the leash. I use it at about 5 feet long in the locked position when he needs to stay close and it's way better than our regular leash. When letting him sniff and explore, I let him I love the comfortable handle. The tape is strong but light and retracts without tangling from any angle. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Best leash out there
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first leash, nor my first Tug. The one I am replacing is just starting to fray after thousands of walks. It take a little more effort to ensure the lock is engaged. Not perfect... but absolutely the best leash on the market. The rewind is nearly perfect. The clever swivel keeps it from kinking and it is comfortable to hold. We love our dog. His breeder made us promise to never take him out except on a leash ‘because if he sees a squirrel or bunny his genetics will take over.’ She is right - and he just does not understand the danger of traffic. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Judson B.

customer_reviews.title: I found the Small size was too big.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use thia for my small 17 lb dog, but found it too large for my liking. Was going to return it, but Amazon made it too difficult without making a 54 mile round trip to a UPS store. My local shipper for UPS packages, cannot use the code given and I was unable to get a printed label, so I sold it to a friend and after trying and trying , I finally found the TINY size on Amazon and ordered it. The Tiny one hasn't come yet but I am looking forward to its arrival. I do wish Amazon would make it possible to print a label for returns when you aren't near a UPS Store.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy fm TN

customer_reviews.title: A terrifying moment
customer_reviews.text: I just had the most terrifying thing happen with this leash. It is heavy and I dropped it. My 4.5 month old dog ran wild as he felt it knocking the pavement behind him. He ran 3 blocks til someone stopped him. He was shaking and scared. DO NOT buy this leash. He could have been killed by a car in his flee to free himself from the plastic and weight of it bouncing behind him. There was NO STOPPING HIM. This is a danger for any pet. Please I hope you never go thru what I did. Thankfully a neighbor caught him or he would still be fleeting. I almost lost my loved new dog.
customer_reviews.author: Queenie

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Responsiveness
customer_reviews.text: Edited - follow up: Tug sent us a replacement at no cost, which we've used for the last 2 weeks with no problems. It spools very smoothly, and the lock button is very easy to use. I enjoy using it. I’m assuming that our first one must’ve been defective, and not the norm. I appreciate their prompt customer service in addressing it. Previous post: We’ve had this leash about 3 days, and today it snapped - broke off right at the connect point between the actual leash and the clip to the dog’s collar. He has been trying to chew the leash, but he couldn’t even reach that point. Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: ReadingMom

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This leash is really sturdy and comfortable to hold. It can handle my pretty wild 80lb lab/put bull mix as we try and train him to walk with us. The locking mechanism is strong and the button is easy to push which, I use constantly because he's quite the puller! I also gotta say that I love the design :) I got the orange trim and love it!! PLUS, I mistakenly left it out and he chewed the button off which they replaced instantly!! Super great leash and customer service! Kinda cant go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Dulanto

customer_reviews.title: Works but dog will run away with the retractable handle and scare itself!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I attached the new retractable handle to my dog’s harness and opened the door, she took off and the retractable handle flew out of my hand and scraped and dragged on the driveway. Scared my dog so much she kept running from the noise! Ha ha! The same thing happened to my husband. Now, before we clip the handle to the dog’s harness, we sit on the retractable handle, clip the handle to the harness, grab hold of the handle then open the door. Wish there was some kind of Velcro strap we could affix to the wrist to avoid the handle from being pulled away from us.
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: Good buy leash tears
customer_reviews.text: I like the build. A little heavy for a puppy but great and sturdy for a dog. The only complaint is the leash tears pretty easy when the puppy we have has chewed on it for a short time while leash training. We don’t let her continue to do it. Once seen we stop her but pretty freyed after a few times of her doing it. The leash is higher price than most retractable so was a little disturbed by that. Other than that issue it’s a good leash
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Virgilio

customer_reviews.title: Best available!  Doesn’t tangle.
customer_reviews.text: I got a couple of other brands that had a round cord with a short ribbon at the end. The round cord had a tendency to knot/tangle when being retracted. THIS brand uses a full length ribbon, which doesn’t knot. It’s a good weight and size. The short black non-chew optional extension is handy for hooking the handle to my car headrest, to keep the dog safe(r) in the car. My only wish was that it was reflective - so I bought a couple of reflective stick-on circles, which look great and make my dog and I safer at night:
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: I used the attachment and it frayed in half so now I am afraid it will tear completely so I removed it. I might try to repair it by sewing it . It's a good idea but I don't think the attachment was stronger than the regular leash. The leash itself operates flawlessly. She twisted it all up (doing what I call her "zoomies" and it unraveled easily.) I like it overall. My old one lasted 20 years and finally broke when the pup pulled too hard. I hope this one lasts half as long. I'd recommend it and also recommend that they improve the strength on the attachment.
customer_reviews.author: teachy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Had Bought This Sooner
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best leash I’ve ever used. When it comes to my pets, I spare no expense... but I have to admit that I have totally “cheaped out” on retractable leashes over the years. Of course, every single one of those fell apart—DUH. The TUG is absolutely fantastic! I went ahead and purchased the large, even though my puppy is young and still small. The handle is very comfortable in my hand. Everything functions very smoothly. There is no sudden snap-back or jerking when my puppy comes running toward me after having fully extended the length of the leash. I love everything about this leash and wish I had bought it sooner. FIVE STARS!!!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReader

customer_reviews.title: A few months later and...
customer_reviews.text: Update: 12/2019 The leash has started to come apart. Looks like it couldn’t handle a husky and Australian Shepard I’ve had this leash for a few months to walk my husky and Australian Sheppard. The leash handle could be a bit more ergonomic. The leash itself started to get folded inside the leash and that made it so that it would not retract past a certain length. I have to constantly manually pull the entire leash out and make sure its not folding in on itself.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: very well made leash
customer_reviews.text: I have a doggy daycare business and go through a lot of leashes. I was very impressed with the Tug leash as soon as I opened the package (by the way, even the packaging is top quality). The leash is very well made and sturdy for my larger dogs and I find the price very reasonable for the quality. I have paid more for retractables that I bought at chain pet stores and they broke after about a month of constant use. I am feeling confident that this beauty will hold up much longer and serve my purpose. I would definitely recommend buying this retractable leash.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, stiff to pull.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today so can’t comment on durability. It seems well made but it is large and heavy. It is stiff for the dog to pull. I have an 80 pound golden retriever so it’s doable for her, but I wouldn’t recommend it for a smaller dog or for a dog owner with small or arthritic hands. Also, the clip is smaller than my older retractible leashes. Seems everything is made cheaper than it used to be. Being a senior citizen, I remember when things were made to last. I guess young people don’t realize the difference. Hope built in obsolesce is not true for this leash.
customer_reviews.author: Krazy About My Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Solid performing leash...
customer_reviews.text: Good product that keep the dog in control and also lets the dog roam and smell around without getting too far from you. This gives him more exercise and you can stay at your walking pace. Lets the dog be a dog more than a short leash. Of course you can make this short, and lock it, when other dogs are around or when other hazards are around you, then unlock leash and allow the dog to zip around at different bushes and trees and grasses. Dogs need to be able to have time to explore new smells for their mental well being. Good product for dogs that like a little freedom.
customer_reviews.author: CyberBuyer

customer_reviews.title: I just downgraded this unit, it's too big, jams CONSTANTLY!
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, very well made, I give it three stars because it's just TOO darn big compared to others I've owned. Makes no difference how "comfortable" it is if it weighs twice as much. Update: Having used for a month, I don't like this AT ALL. It's seems to jam constantly, always at the wrong time, the spring doesn't rewind near as well as my Wal Mart model I've had for ten years, that weighs half as much, and it IS NOT ergonomic, it forces your hand into an uncomfortable, downward leaning position. Lot's of people disagree, as it is nicely made, for me, with an eighty pound golden puppy, it just didn't work very well.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best Customer Service Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable retractable leash I've used and I really like it; but my reason for five stars is Tug's customer service. The lead broke after a couple weeks use. I contacted Tug via their web site on a Sunday. They responded that same day and the following Tuesday a replacement leash arrived in my mail box.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE two of 3 of these lasted barely 1/2 year
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a very positive review shortly after purchasing 3 of these. Now, less than 7 months Later, two of the leashes are no longer functional. The brake no longer works and that is asking for an accident. I no longer recommend this leash.
customer_reviews.author: MisterFrosty

customer_reviews.title: A great product ... well for as long as it lasts
customer_reviews.text: We got this product in mid 2018.. and it worked absolutely great for until recently. 6 months back the lock stopped working. And now the retractable option stopped working. So now we have a super long floating leash with a heavy box at one end. It was awesome when it worked.. but not sure why the life of the product is limited. Hence the lower stars. I'll be looking at other possible options for my replacement. FYI..the box that holds the nylon leash and retracting mechanism is heavy..and very well made (solid product) . But it is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: PA

customer_reviews.title: Lefty approved!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is approximately 13 lbs and generally well behaved on a leash. This leash is so much better than the one we had been using from the big box pet store. It is more of a ribbon than a wire, and it un-spools smoothly. The locking mechanism is easy to flick with either my left or right hand thumb. The only thing that is different about this leash is that if you unclip it from your pooch with the leash at regular height it will snap up so quickly that the clip will slap your hand-rather painfully. Just make sure the handle is close to the pooch, and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Quality leash, pet approved
customer_reviews.text: I've used retractable leashes for years and it was time to replace an old one. I bought the medium for my 16 lb cairn terrier. We use it primarily when running together, to allow for greater flexibility. This leash feels solid and well made. The black area of the handle is a different texture and is ready to grip. The locking and unlocking is smooth and simple. The tape lead has performed well, also. So far, no tangles and the retraction works exactly as I'd hoped, keeping a light but steady pressure on the line. After three runs with this leash, we give it two paws up!
customer_reviews.author: Lainey SoCal

customer_reviews.title: NICELY BALANCED, FEELS GOOD IN THE HAND, AND FACILITATES CONTROL OF THE MUTT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. I have arthritis and carpal tunnel syndrome and other physical issues that make it important to have as ergonomically correct as possible daily tools. I have wide hands and was afraid that this small retractable leash would be too small for me to hold, but I needn't have worried. It is a nice size, not heavy, feels solid, and is easy to use, which is good because my little dog is only about 14 pounds or so. He doesn't need a bigger leash. Over the years, I have tried many brands and, so far, this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Silver_Rose

customer_reviews.title: Big heavy handle... just ok
customer_reviews.text: I really like the extra attachment because my dog toes bite at his leash sometimes and this seems to be a lot stronger. The leash itself is pretty heavy and seems like it will last awhile. However, for the length of the leash this handle is huge and very heavy which really seems unnecessary. Also, the winding mechanism is a bit sluggish and clunky. I walk my 70 lb Goldendoodle 2-3 times a day in an area with a lot of other dogs. I was looking for something easily retractable to keep him from getting to rambunctious with other dogs. I don’t think this leash will last long and I probably won’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Overall, it’s strong and we’re happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, comfortable grip, nice and strong retractable ribbon. My only issue is the lock, it’s difficult to explain, but I notice that if you are bouncing along (say your dog keep reaching the limit you set for them and it engages the lock), for some reason it can disengage the lock. About 3 bounces and the lock disengages. It’s not a huge deal because you get used to the feel of it disengaging and you can reengage it, but it might cause some troubles if in the mean time your big ol’ beast sees a bunny! In fact, I may even get another, despite this “flaw”, but just thought it’s worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Budstein

customer_reviews.title: Good for big dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I was tired of our dogs getting tangled up. I wasn’t sure if they would be good for our dogs, but they work great. I’m surprised the leash doesn’t slip when locked since my husky and German Shepard pull so hard sometimes. But it stays locked every time. Not even slight slipping. The lock is super easy to lock, and keep locked. I think my only concern would be how large the actual handle is. But if you only have one dog, it’s not really that bad. I just like to hold the two in one hand. Other than that, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Near death situation
customer_reviews.text: Walking my 60 pound dog one afternoon; the leash snapped and broke, and my dog almost got hit by a car. Scared my dog and me ..... after two months of the leash working great, near death situation made me realize this product is extremely defective. I read a lot of the reviews before purchasing this product ( 2 months ago), and thought this product would be great. My views have drastically changed; I will purchase from another company. Dog lovers be aware ..... be careful with this leash ..... I am extremely fortunate my doggie only had some scrapes and cuts .... it could have been tragic.
customer_reviews.author: laura h.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome leash - but even better customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a retractable leash that could handle my big, loves-to-pull Samoyed, and I was sick of my other one getting snagged/tangled. This one is a beast 💪! It worked beautifully for over a year, then developed a fray on the edge of the tape. I was a little heartbroken, but decided to email the company to see if they had any sort of warranty. I wrote to them on a Sunday night, and a brand new replacement leash was at my house on Tuesday morning. They wrote right back apologizing, and asked for a photo because they're constantly trying to improve their design. We were so impressed with their service, and still love the leash!
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks to do this review to make sure there were no problems . The handle is sturdy and probably the best out there, the thread is thicker and more durable in my opinion than a thin wire string, the length is ok at 16 though would be nice if it were longer . The only problem is the retraction can stick and not work at times and you have to pull it in - I’m guessing because of the thicker cord , besides that it is well-made with a choice to quickly stop your dog and also lock him/her from going any farther by flipping the switch up. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AJW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent retractable leash
customer_reviews.text: I really like this leash alot because of couple things... 1. The leash has a nice "Tug" between the walker and dog... It really gives you the feel like you got a good control of the dog. 2. The leash is flat and thick but doesn't tangle up when retracting back into the holder. 3. I like the stopper because it allow you to temporary stop the drop without having to lock it into position 4. Overall it seem to be made of good material. Now.. the true test is?? Does it last for more then 6months? We will see
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Smith

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd read more reviews. This is an inferior product
customer_reviews.text: Did not last a year with my 70 lb pit-mix. The retracting mechanism broke in the extended position and this leash has no external screws to open it up for repair (even if I DID know what I was doing.) I am retired and don't make enough money to be wasting on inferior products. I like retractable leashes but I am going to have to do more research. This one worked and felt good while it lasted, but you can't take looks to the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is just another ordinary retractable leash. Doesn’t have any extras. But, I give it five stars because it’s well made and feels like it will last for a long while. Purchased in December... no sign of giving up anytime soon. I also like the leash portion. It’s not a rope but rather like a thick ribbon. The handle part feels good in the hand and is easy to operate. My dog is <10lbs and spins a lot when looking for the most optimal spot... haven’t had trouble with the spun up ribbon retracting. There is a mechanism that helps avoid that problem.
customer_reviews.author: GLJ

customer_reviews.title: Hefty and works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I bought the medium TUG 360 degree Tangle Free in both red and blue. This is my first time buying the TUG brand. They both came with an extra foot long attachment to give an extra foot in length. My dogs are only 20 and 15 pounds each. I bought the medium size instead of small because the 15 pounder is young and always pulls and strains against the leash. He has done this to the point that he has broken other brands (size small) so that they don’t retract anymore. I hoped that the medium size and the TUG brand would hold up better. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: just another Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Product/EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had my Tug for almost a full year and absolutely loved it. Then the other day out of the blue it just stopped retracting. I hopped on Amazon to order another one and then thought...maybe it's under warranty. I went to the Tug website and filled out what broke, my order #, and current address, and the within the hour I had an email from Tug with an apology for the issue AND a tracking # for the new Tug leash they had already shipped to my residence. I mean...that's EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I received the new Tug within two days and would highly recommend this product to anyone...even prior to experiencing the pleasure of their outstanding customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Seems alright but rope part frayed after a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Loud clicking when you try to lock it as the dog is pulling, but not a really big deal. Just a loud plastic sound. Feels solid, works good, but the doggo panicked and wrapped the leash around a table leg and the rope is now frayed. I'm guessing it isn't safe anymore for the strength rating. I got this for my girlfriend ☹️ also I'm not sure it's going to operate smoothly anymore. I saw the damage happen but didn't notice how. She said the rope caught on the curvy plastic part at the mouth of the device and frayed apart.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Not if your dog it’s learning to walk next of you.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good quality, but my poppy pull to much and make nuts all around the ribbon, one site is bited by my puppy and it’s not save for get anymore ;(. It’s was good at the start so just in our house garden, because she gets more freedom to jump and run. But it’s not the best option if you need them to walk next of you. Now she is always trying to chase us and pulling from her leash. Because of the, now we are using an other one no retráctil, and she is trying to get use to with this change and it’s not easier, once you have them freedom, she demands it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: If my large lab dog, Champ, see’s a new dog, he will dash towards that new “friend”. This happened the day I was using his new leash. The sleek smooth feel was comfortable and fit into my hands very well. However, the leash quickly unlocked and slid out of my hands. The nylon chord wrapped around my fingers and broke blood vessels swelling blood red! Champ has dashed out many a time but his leashes have never done that. I will be returning this leash. I ordered a leash for large dogs. This one clearly cannot handle a large dog.
customer_reviews.author: Pearland Terp

customer_reviews.title: A Sturdy, Quality Leash.
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, I use this leash for my Bichon 1-year old! Due to intense activity all day long and lots of outside walks, he is extremely strong and actually muscular. It is a real effort to hold him back at some times. This leash is exactly what we needed... It was an upgrade from a similar, but weaker, leash. He does not chew, but we put the expansion on so that the heavy handle would not snap into him if he jerked it away from us. I really love the strength and comfort of this very solid leash.
customer_reviews.author: Dana French

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This works so far, however it has two annoying issues. The basic locking (the manual one you hold down with your thumb) gets jammed if your dog is tugging so the leash doesn't reel in unless the dog stops..which can be dangerous if you need your dog led away from something. The locking noise is also pretty loud, which isn't a huge deal although it might startle/scare your pup if they are skittish. Only had it for a week or two and it's held up fine with minimal usage. Here's hoping it holds up when my puppy is old enough for real walks..
customer_reviews.author: S.D.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality - small puppy broke 2 of them within days
customer_reviews.text: The thousands of reviews here are almost certainly fake and written by review farms. This leash is absolute GARBAGE. We got the first one and the locking mechanism broke within days. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, we got a replacement. The replacement had the locking mechanism AND the spool break on use #3. So it won't retract, won't lock, etc. It's useless. And it's not like we have a big strong dog tugging at it or something.... we have a tiny little chihuahua mix PUPPY. This thing is a joke; go find any other leash in the whole world and I assure you you'll be better off.
customer_reviews.author: Cabell

customer_reviews.title: Very Smooth and Durable
customer_reviews.text: We were in a time crunch when we purchased the first retractable leash for our puppy. Needless to say, it did not last. The locking mechanism was hard to operate, the leash was thin, and because our puppy likes to "hold" the leash in his mouth, he had practically chewed through it within two weeks. So far, this leash is a huge improvement! It is smooth, the lock is easy to operate, I love the pause feature, and it came with an extra heavy-duty attachment for those of us who have chewers. I am thrilled with the TUG leash!
customer_reviews.author: mammamia

customer_reviews.title: Survived exactly one year, warranty replacement already arrived
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this leash for a year with a 50lb dog. It works well; the lock is easy to use and retraction is smooth. I once ran it over and it survived that with barely a scratch!! If you had asked me a month ago I would have said 5 stars! However, on the last day of my warranty, I went to take the dog out and it wouldn't retract. I didn't waste any time filling out the warranty claim on the website and had a replacement in 2 days. I hope the new one lasts longer than a year!
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten it sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality item (so far). Feels well made. Locking mechanism feels very solid and trustworthy when it grabs. My dog is still learning on a leash, and this thing gives me comfortable sturdy hold on my 60lbs Pit Lab mix mutt. Gives her more space to have an illusion of more freedom being 16 feet away from me at length. This seems to calm some of her leash anxiety. So far I love it after just one long walk today. So long as the quality has longevity and time will tell but so far this is the best one of its kind I've ever seen or used. I'd recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Dog Running around you in circles? 360 degree feature is the solution!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescue that has never been leash trained. She runs erratically back and forth and in circles. She has tangled two older leads and broken the retractable button. The 360 degree feature and the ribbon lead were attractive selling points. I have used the lead for about a week and 360 degrees is a great feature. It is very sturdy and feels good in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: C Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for a puppy and an adult dog.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I really appreciate this leash coming with an extender in case of chewing. I got this for my lab puppy and it took about a month before she managed to puncture the extension. I would have been angry if she had chewed the leash up that fast. I never would have thought about an extension if they hadn’t included it with the leash. The leash is going to last from puppy to adult since it is rated for an duly dog. I love that my puppy can have room to run or be locked right next to me depending on where we are.
customer_reviews.author: Jess' Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4 months, but excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit that I loved this leash. It is really easy to hold and use the lock function. However, the strap unexpectedly snapped after 4 months of mild use. Unfortunately I am past Amazon's return window, and they can't do anything about it. I guess this product is only guaranteed to last a few months. UPDATE: I contacted the seller (TUG) to let them know what happened, and they are shipping me a replacement. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Lynn Froehlich

customer_reviews.title: One of the best out there
customer_reviews.text: I've evaluated Tug, Flexi (two styles), Walkabout (old/new designs). IMO, Tug and Flexi Classic are the two best leashes I've tried. Tug is a tape, not cable, system that is very smooth in operation, and virtually tangle free, even going through brush. It's locking system works great, and for my hands, is easy to operate. I slightly prefer the cable system of Flexi but really, both work equally well, but the Flexi is slightly smaller, due to the cable taking up less room on the spool. So yes, the Tug is a great leash so far, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkererguy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Quality and Durable Product -80lb Ridgeback
customer_reviews.text: I had doubt of a $19 leash being as good as people say. Let ME say- it far exceeded my expectations. I have an 80lb Ridgeback Lab that is an absolute tank. He pulls like a horse and runs like a greyhound. Lets just say he has tested the limits of this leash and it has held up wonderfully. Locking mechanism works like a charm. Very easy on/off. High quality nylon leash. Came with an extender attachment. If your dog likes to bite the leash this is a must and was a freebie extra to boot. 5 out of 5. 100% Excellent
customer_reviews.author: H&M C&Co.

customer_reviews.title: Liked it until it failed after 14 months
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying my dog is only 19 lbs, but he's not the best behaved boy on the leash. He's tugging or being tugged a off and on during our walks. Still, this leash is rated up to 50 lb dogs so you would think it would hold up more than 14 months. This was my first retractable leash purchase and I was happy with it for about a year. That's when the edge of the leash material started to fray. Still not a huge deal I just trimmed the frayed part and kept using it. Then last night the spring mechanism inside just gave up. I'm now shopping for a different leash.
customer_reviews.author: bgries7

customer_reviews.title: The locking feature is kinda bad.
customer_reviews.text: I've used several extendable leashes over the years, and the worst ones for me have always been the forward pushing lock. The times I want to lock it is when my dog is pulling towards something and I have to somehow hold it down, push it up while holding on to the leash at the same time. It's difficult. The mechanisms seem solid, and holding it feels good, but the locking mechanism wasn't great for me. I think this leash will last a long time before it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Small is a little to much for small dog
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the overall product. Feels good in the hand, smooth leash action, and the multi-purpose button is easy to use. The version labeled "small" is really meant for an animal 12-15lbs. or larger. Both the tension of the leash and the weight of the lobster clip is tolerable but not ideal for a full size chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable
customer_reviews.text: After breaking two other inferior retractable leashes this one is strong, durable and perfect for our 85lb lab who loves to pull. It takes a lot of stress off us as well as we’re not being jerked around. It’s easy to pull him in when needed or let him explore a little without yanking my shoulder off. Another great feature is the extra cutout on the handle to anchor it to an umbrella or post, we use that on our bike handlebar when we are running him, works great. Overall, great product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindyo

customer_reviews.title: Best Leash Out There!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS LEASH!!! After many failed leashes by flezi, I came across this one. I have had it for about 3 months now, which is 2.5 month more than the flexi leash lasted. I love the size and hold of this leash. When my dogs does try to pull, I oush the hold button and I dont get jerked like I did with other leashes. It has great handle and allows my dog to move in all directions without disturbing my walking direction or pace. I love it and will be sure to keep buying from this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm generally not a fan of flexi-leashes b/c people tend to use them in crowed places and don't have proper control of their dogs. That being said, it is perfect for my 13lb terrier who is losing her hearing. It gives her a bit of that "off-leash" feeling in the park while still remaining safe and connected to me. I do not use it when there are other dogs or people around.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite and I've Unfortunately Bought a Lot of Leashes
customer_reviews.text: My dog looks like she should weigh about 30 lbs, she is actually 50 lbs of deceptively dense muscle. We buy retractable leashes for up to 120 lb dogs and within 3 months she's worn it down and snaps it on a walk, at one point when the cord fully retracted after breaking and I couldn't tie it I had to string together poop bags like I'm sneaking out the window of a castle. We've got two of these and both have been the best we've got so far, very sturdy feeling and durable, comfortable to hold, and look nicer than most, it also happens to be one of the most competitively priced, absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brett V

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet!
customer_reviews.text: Our lab puppy chewed through her first retractable leash in a week. This one she tried and I wrapped the end in gorilla tape. It has held up well. Still will need replacing but it’s not the products fault she is a chewer. She is 4 mo old and 40 lbs already! She tugs HARD at times and is still learning but it has held up. Sometimes the lock feature catches and I have to try and get it to release but in general I’m happy with this purchase and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: feedbags

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for a Golden Doodle
customer_reviews.text: I have been through three of these in six months. I purchased one and the leash broke... purchased another and the leash broke... Tug refunded this one and sent me another... and it broke. This would be a good leash for a small dog who is not active, but I don't recommend it for a large dog or an active dog (especially a golden doodle). The third time this one broke in public and luckily she listened to my command to stop and sit. I will not be using this again for my dog despite the good customer support. My dog is trained and behaves well, too.
customer_reviews.author: UMFAN

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Lightweight, Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: My little dog is 11 lbs, so this works perfectly. It is small and lightweight, the return spring pressure is not over powered, so my dog doesn't have to fight strong spring pressure while walking on the leash. The lock button is very easy to use, and there is very little noise as the leash is retracted. The hook clasp is small, so large hands may have issues hooking and unhooking to the dog collar. Seems durable, and should last. Great Value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff from Sunny Florida

customer_reviews.title: Best Retractable Leash in 16 years' Experience
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through so many retractable leashes in my years as a dog owner! Most of them, regardless of price, have been pieces of junk - waiting to jam, fail to retract, or fall apart. The TUG is a sleek-looking, solid, well-made, and comfortable-to-grasp retractable leash. I use the "Large" size for my 45 pound Lab Retriever, and it works beautifully. I really like that the handle/grip fits my large hands -- EVEN when I'm wearing gloves in the winter! I am going to order another one of these to use with my other dog.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: because my dogs figure out they can chew thru the core easily. I have purchased more than a dozen
customer_reviews.text: hello Tim. your leash is performing well so far. I have used retractible leashs for many years, mostly Flexi's, which I consider the standard for this type of leash. Why: because they perform well for years, they don't jam, they tolerate harsh abuse. The versions with tape rather than a core are preferred, because my dogs figure out they can chew thru the core easily. I have purchased more than a dozen. Unfortunately i can't find Flexi's with tape lead anymore. So that's why I bought your product. I hope your product's name, with "tangle-free, heavy duty" in the name proves to be accurate. jimpaulus
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not special
customer_reviews.text: At first, I liked this leash. It preformed like it should and was comfortable to hold. After about a dozen times using it, it started to lock up and became difficult to unlock. Returned this and replaced with the same, medium size. Same issue. It locks up and won't unlock unless you monkey with it. I am not a fan at all. I have little dogs that like to run ahead of me. I can't be constantly fidgeting with the locking mechanism. I would pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Nice leash
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our almost 90 lb Golden who is pretty mellow but likes to get in the water at the beach when we don't want to. Then we got another Golden who absolutely goes bonkers for the beach waves and so we used it for him. It seems pretty strong even tho he tends to pull to run into the water. Bummed tho, because he chewed through it on the way home. My daughter usually unleashes them in the car but I took them and didn't think about doing that and he must've gotten it stuck around the seat area, so now we are back to our old leashes.
customer_reviews.author: KH Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you LOVE your pet do NOT BUY this leech!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in April & received it on April 25th. I currently have a 5 mo old Labrador Retriever who at this point only weights 50 lbs. The leech I ordered above was for large dogs up to 110lbs. When not in use it’s in a closet with her harness. Just started using within the last 30-45 days and we’re out walking yesterday and the leech breaks. Luckily we were close to home and no cars were coming. If you love your pet stay away from this leech. Not trust worthy. Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: TUG 360° Tangle-Free, Heavy Duty Retractable Dog Leash with Anti-Slip Handle; 16 ft Strong Nylon Tape/Ribbon; One-Handed Brake, Pause, Lock
feature_bullets: Small Leash is Suitable for Dogs Under 35 lbs; Medium For Dogs Under 55 lbs; Large For Dogs Under 110 lbs
16 ft Tape Leash With Easy-Adjust Retraction; Tangle Free 360 Degree Tape Movement
Quick Lock And Unlock Feature - Easy Roll-On and Roll-Off With Your Thumb
Super Comfortable Grip For Those Long Walks! Ergonomic Anti-Slip Handle
Note: Large Leash May Be Larger Than Expected; Please Review Dimensions Before Purchase

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
